page.title: 08SMALL SHOPS IN RAMSGATE
page.content: Although there are some large shops in the town centre, there are many small ones which offer a wide range of goods & services.People tend to stick to their "usual" shops for certain items. Several shops sell fresh foods such as fruit,vegetables,cakes,bread and meat. Clothing and shoe shops are abundant , especially those selling ladies clothes These "boutiques" have a fairly short life due to competition & constant fashion changes.Premises close to the sea-front,in Harbour Street and York Street are usually cafes & restaurants, catering mainly for holidaymakers.Some public houses are found in this area. Shops selling boating equipment are near the Harbour. Addington Street is a separate shopping centre.It once had a wide variety of shops but it now has several antique shops, 2 pubs,cafes & a few other shops including a haberdasher
